poem:
**Changing Guards**

Netanyahu's shadow faltered
as Biden stepped back—
an old lion retreating,
making way for new roars.
Harris, bright against the twilight,
her voice thunder over quiet whispers.
In DC's corridor,
the echoes of intent rescale,
Trump's tower trembles,
a city re-tuned by departure,
metamorph and handover.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Netanyahu upstaged by Biden and Harris on highly anticipated US visit Benjamin Netanyahu expected to land in Washington DC this week with a bang. So far, it has been more of a whimper. The Israeli prime minister has kept a low profile in the US capital, which was stunned by Joe Biden’s decision on Sunday to drop out of the presidential race and endorse his vice-president, Kamala Harris, to challenge Donald Trump. Netanyahu’s first 24". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
